Reviews.Title: “Family stay, a bit far away”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my brother, his wife, and my best friend during our road trip through Italy in May '09. We got into town and parked on the street. Luckily they have a garage so my brother was able to park the car there. The hotel is far from the historic center. It is on the other side of the main train station, close to the university and hospital. Lots of young folk around the area and lots of great, inexpensive places to eat. Walking up the steps, you go in through the automatic glass doors and head on into the lobby area where the reception desk is. The lobby is nice and large and bright. The person who checked us in was young and quite professional. She got us our keys and we headed up the elevator to our room. We had decided to all stay in one room to help with keeping cost down, so there was a queen bed and bunk beds. My buddy and I stayed on the bunk beds which was quite the adventure. I was all the way at the top and at some point at night rolled over and fell onto the floor (ouch!). My buddy and I should've probably got a separate room. The room was large, but simple. Bathroom was clean and a little on the small side. The decor was simple as well, not completely outdated, but certainly not contemporary. For the price, we did good, but everything was quite far in regards to walking, but we did do the walking just to enjoy the stroll. If we had no where else to go to, we would stay here again in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Nxaman
Reviews.Content: The room was really big, with a king-sized bed. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. The only inconvenient with the room was the bathroom. Such a big room with such a small bathroom. The shower was really small, with IKEA curtains. You could not turn around the shower without touching the curtains and having all the water going out. Moreover, the water pressure was really low and you could not adjust the temperature of the water: either freezing cold or boiling hot. Breakfast was ok, with a decent selection of pastries, fruits, cereals, cheeses etc. The staff was helful.

Reviews.Title: “Practical Hotel near Roma La Sapienza University and Polyclinique”
Reviews.Author: Desert_Quark
Reviews.Content: Close to Rome 1 University which I visited, which is half way if you like a 25 min walk to the Roma Termin train station. It is an apartment building converted to hotel so each room is different. This is in recent weeks my third stay and each room had something else which was nice.Breakfast is very rich but no thrill, if you do no like Nescafe expresso machiene ask for real Italian coffee, Just about anybody who did got it served with a smile-- I must say the people in that hotel are overall very nice, all of them, restaurant, reception, etc. The reception area offers Americano coffee most of the time, water, juice, nice small pastries. I like to complain about hotels (see reviews I wrote) but here I can say "nice no thrill, nothing special, just good service and location if you have business at University or the nearby hospital complex". For a tourist it is a bit off the beaten track but we did do fine using metro, station is 10 min walk, line B reaches the Colloseum in another 10 minutes direct ride, no changes. WiFi in rooms usually in yellow so some people need to go to the lobby to have reliable connection. Id quite well in all rooms I stayed in, also using telephony via internet. So signal is very stable even if not very strong.

Reviews.Title: “Between the poor and the average”
Reviews.Author: Niebes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is outside of the center of Rome, however not far away by taxi (at night 10 minutes from the center). The reception is ok and the service quite helpfull. Indeed, it looks like a nice hotel. However, the rooms are poor: small, quite small, and the bed looks old, quite old. The bathroom is also quite quite smal. On the good side, everything looks quite clean. There was no plug available to connect by laptop, so I had to disconnect the TV to turn the computer on...which is not the best approach. The interrnet was free and working well. The breakfast is bellow average, with nothing special to have. The expresso was of weak quality. In resume, an hotel to stay one night, on a business trip. The price, for Rome, is good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western high standard, quirky receptionists”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice. May 2009 and December 2011. Professional hospitality. The hotel is cool in early summer and warm in winter. Breakfast offer is diverse and both wholesome and fulsome. Very clean guest rooms and the communal areas were spotless. Complimentary refreshments and pastries are available in the reception's bright lounge area throughout the day. Adjacent to university district - where its energetic students talking on street corners keep the area safe for walkers. Metro a short walk - 5 minute saunter. Main train station less than ten minute walk away. If you are used to walking I recommend using your feet to explore Rome. The reception staff were a little quirky, not creepy, just a bit different. A good clean value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Globus”
Reviews.Author: james h
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June 2011. The hotel is a straight forward business hotel. The breakfast was diverse and plentiful. A very mixed crowd which was nice. A popular hotel. The staff were very nice and helpful. The hotel is right in the midst of the University (La Sapienza). The metro is a good walking distance. It is not as well located to the forum and sights as we wanted. We had to take a taxi or walk to the metro. Would have paid more to be centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: wtraveler64
Reviews.Content: it is a BW so no surprises ... however good location in university district, very quiet at night and not much in the surroundings. 5 minutes walking from metro station. Rooms are clean and confortable I stayed in 3rd and 5th floor. I find it full of family and lot of childrens (may be there was some special promo ...) and everybody seems to enjoy the atmosphere. Breakfast may take longer becuse there are some bottlenecks in the kitchen furniture, similar problems in the restaurant at night due to limited personnel. In any case the quality of the food and qaulity/price is good (i would say excellent but they add too much salt in the food). the Staff during the day is professional during the night may be better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkdas
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome with my wife and son from 9th November 2011 to 14th November 2011. We stayed in BW Hotel Globus. It is an excellent hotel. We have really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Hotel dining Hall at the basement is really superb. The staf are very much cooperative and kind enough. Food was fantastic. I like to come again with my family to Rome and want to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but not really near the sights of rome”
Reviews.Author: EuropeLover_9
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean hotel with good rooms and free wi fi. The breakfasts are fine. It is the best value I have seen in Rome but one has to be clear that it is somewhat "off" the center of town. It is at least a 30-45 min walk to the termini where you catch buses all over Rome. That being said you can take the 310 bus in front of the hotel to the Termini or the Policinico subway stop (10 min walk) that goes to the Termini or Colosseium. Plan on using either public transport or taxis (expensive) if you stay here. There are a few good restaurants nearby which the staff will direct you to. It is also a great walk to the Pz. Bolonia with wonderful shopping and some restaurants about 3 blocks away. I was there for work at the University but would staff again if work took me downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AcharyaSunil
Reviews.Content: This is a regular Premier Inn like hotel. The rooms are clean and well maintained daily. The distance from the station is 10 minute walk. The location is good but not central. The area is dull but then we went into town every day. Rome is allot about walking. The morning breakfast is the same every day. We did get bored after the 3rd day. Overall a good hotel if you are not too worried about being central and are happy to catch the Tram and metro each day.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: originsteve
Reviews.Content: The first thing to say is that the staff at the front desk were very helpful and very pleasant. Unfortunately that is the only nice thing we can say about the hotel. We went there for two nights for my son's 21st. We knew it was a bit out away from the centre and therefore cheaper but ...... The rooms were very small and the bathrooms were tiny with only a small shower. There was no hot water unless you ran the sink and the shower for 20 minutes. On the last night our cold water stopped working and we had no flushing toilet. One of the lifts was not working. There was no bar apart from in the main restaurant which was souless. While we were checking out two other familes were complaining about other problems. Good job we were hardly in the hotel but for over £125/night it was not good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with awful Internet connection”
Reviews.Author: Sweden99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in quite good condition and lies in a decent area only two stops from the Termini. The room was clean but the shower drain was clogged. During the whole stay all the elevators were out of service. A standard continental breakfast was served in the basement. The Wi-Fi was very bad and it was not even possible to get a signal a few floors up from the reception. They have some really slow computers available by the reception. I would recommend this hotel to other people unless an Internet connection is important. The cost was about 110 € per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emily B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel whilst doing some general Rome sightseeing. The location was convenient with great hotels nearby. Rooms were spacious and well cleaned. WIFI had some signal problems. Breakfast was buffet and very nice. Hotel reception was happy to help with daily travel plans. Free printing which was a bonus. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disstisfied Customers Regarding Room”
Reviews.Author: mealypied69000
Reviews.Content: On 7 August 2011 we booked a room for September 25. When we received confirmation of the booking we noticed that a Smoking Room had been allocated. On 8 August we requested a Non Smoking Room and this was confirmed by a return e mail. Whe we arrived at the hotel we were allocated Room 220 on the 2nd Floor which we presumed would be a non smoking room. To our horror when we opened the door we were greeted by a blu haze of smoke. We immediately retrurned to the hotel lobby and requested a non smoking room and the reception advised us that all the 2nd floor was non smoking and there were no other rooms available however eventually she agreed to have the room sprayed for us. We had a horrible night as we had the windows opened to try and get rid ogf the lingering smell of smoke unfortunately the night we stayed there was a violent thunderstorm and with the windows opened no sleep was possible. Whe we saw an ash tray in the room then obviously the receptionist had not told us the truth and when we pointed this out to hear she confirmed that the ash tray was for the previous guest. It was a disppointment as we had stayed in 8 different totels on our 2 week tour of Italy and this was the only hotel room where the smell of smoke ruined our night having always requested non smoking rooms. Other than this using the metro it was reasonable to find when we were shown which direction to go by a passer by who we are forever grateful as she went out of her way to accompany us the street where the hotel was situated.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE internet, phone defective, rooms need better cleaning”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsSprouter
Reviews.Content: I booked this via the official Best Western site, after seeing all the positive reviews. I was thrilled that I was able to book a competitive rate for a "superior Business Room, Luxury Bathroom Toiletries, Free Minibar, Free Room Service, Full Breakfast." When I got to Termini station, I tried calling the hotel for directions, and must've spent a good 20 mins dialing but getting only a busy signal. I was tired, had luggage and it was late so I just grabbed a cab even though I knew it wasn't far. (I paid 6€ + some extras including a tax for having picked up the taxi at the station and 1€ for luggage = 8€ something). After I checked in, I asked if I did get a business room because I needed to work, and the guy wasn't sure what that was but gave me another room that he said had "luxury bathroom items." Well, what I got was a normal room for 4 people - 2 huge beds, tons of regular toiletries + a sample liquid soap of some kind which perhaps made the toiletries "luxurious" and tons of water in the minibar fridge + 1 coke + 1 juice. I had problems connecting to the wifi but finally managed after trying for almost an hour. A local friend tried to call me in my room but had to call me on my roaming mobile to say that the hotel number was always busy - just as I had experienced earlier. Reception confirmed there was a problem with their regular number and gave me another number. Then when my friend did get through, we couldn't talk for all the buzzing and crackling on the phone. Front desk then had to send someone over to check the phone, confirm it was defective, and gave me a new phone. Then wifi totally stopped working finally and reception confirmed that this is normal at night due to heavy usage! So basically I spent the first 2-3 hours of my stay trying to use the phone and internet, very normal services that come with a hotel, and a "business" hotel at that! Oh and there were pieces of candy wrapper and misc bits of trash on the floor and dust bunnies under the bed and the towels smelled sour. Couldn't find an English channel on TV other than MTV. Not even CNN? The bed was comfy though and breakfast was decent and staff was more or less helpful and it's not far from Termini station. But I would not stay here again because I need my wifi for work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: crigolin
Reviews.Content: The room was confortable and clean. The staff was very nice and helpfull. The location was close to the Metro. We would go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: adynatos
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, very comfortably located in a safe area (can leave the car in the street), good transportation. Staff very polite, breakfast and restaurant perfect (the choice of honeys is worth mentioning!), both wifi in the rooms and internet in the lobby. One of the best middle-range priced hotels I ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with good accomodations for familes of 4 or 5”
Reviews.Author: ejpbowie
Reviews.Content: A family of five stayed here for one night...needed a hotel in Rome close to the metro that could accomodate all of us. Very good value in July that included free internet and breakfast. Room was quiet, AC worked well. Breakfast was ok, but staff had some trouble keeping up with demand. Not much parking available, but parked for free overnight on the street out front.

Reviews.Title: “"Staff should be more polite, internet connection not good"”
Reviews.Author: aajk189929
Reviews.Content: The internet connection was not what I excpected! At the first day, I got 24hour internet ticket. I was really happy with that. It was excellent. But after this, you got only internet connection password for 1 hour. And every hour you have to go downstairs to get a new password. And the staff explains. "We had to change this to one our, because the internet is not planned for so many people, that we have living in the hotel." I say that, then you have to get more connections. Staff is not polite. Feels like its my fault that so many other people want to use internet as well. All they say is just stupid explaining. They said that, I should be happy having free internet connection. Even smaller hotels can have many internet connections and if the hotel is for 400 people, then they should get internet to match with that. Room was nice. The breakfast for not really good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellenttt !!!”
Reviews.Author: setinhas
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews in the tripadvisor, me and my boyfriend, and took a chance.... The hotel is really confortable and the staff is helpful. Our room had a queen bed, bathroom, closet and a balcony. It was really spacious. The breakfast was really good, big variety and quantity. The hotel has two computers you can use for free and you can also print. The hotel is near the metro station of Policlinico, more or less 5m walking. Also you can get the 310 to the termini station the stop is in front of the hotel. The area surrounding the hotel is really calm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: imgoingnowherefast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June 2011 and loved it. This hotel is a15 min walk from the Termini Train station and has bus stops just outside the hotel. The employees in the hotel are very friendly and accomodated every request. The room we stayed in had a queen bed and a bunk bed for my two children. The breakfast in the morning was great. They had cereals, toast, fruit, yogurt, cakes and sugar donuts baked daily and a coffee machine that made any type of coffee you can think of. Overall, this hotel exceed my expectations and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: Agrawalr03
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay... Good Location... Very close to metro and tram. Room was also clean n spacious... However, there was no hot water most of the times.... Wifi was free but didn't work in the room.... Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: EmaEmm
Reviews.Content: It`s a really great hotel!We loved it!Big and roomy room,whit a nice dressroom.It`s very clean!They wash everything every day,they even packed our pijamas.They have a very good breakfast !The internet acces is free,and the personal is very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Best place for Rome trip”
Reviews.Author: emreersoz
Reviews.Content: Location: Hotel was around Termini region, but it is not considered as Rome center. So you'll pay more than 40 Euros for taxi from the airport. From Termini Station It was 10-15 minutes walk. We used Metro-B Polyclinic stop which was 5 minutes walk away. It is a quite neighborhood with schools around. Food: Good breakfast. everyone can find something to eat. From 07:00-10:00. Rooms: Big enough rooms, clean beds and bathroom. Newly decorated. Overall: helpful reservation people, clean, nice price, good overall choice. Best place even if you're just going to spend just nights at hotel and visit Rome for all day like us :) Some Turkish: Bence Roma'da gidilmesi gereken otel budur arkadaşlar. Fiyat/performans süper.. İyi tatiller.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: Felixrs
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife on this hotel for 3 nights. We found a good price for the hotel, and although It's not located near all touristic atractions, the transport from and to the hotel is fine (there's a bus stopping near). The room was big enough and clean. Breakfast was included in the price. There's a nice choice of cold and hot dishes. The staff of the hotel were always very kind with us, helping us to plan our vacations in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “All roads lead to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sprimp
Reviews.Content: Took a walk from Termini but now realise that a better option would have been 310 bus every 10 - 15 mins which stop outside the hotel. Room was small but was all that we needed on the basis that you go to Rome to see things not to sit in your room! Breakfast was fairly comprehensive, a few hot dishes but mainly cold meats, cereals rolls etc Pastries and cakes were delicious and for the good amongst us there was plenty of fresh fruit Yogurts etc. Hotel organised Roma passes for us which were at reception when we arrived. These are a must as you get free entance to 2 sites listed in the booklet and reduced prices at other sites thereafter and more importantly you are fast tracked through the queues. At the Colleseum / forum for instance we were in within 1 - 2 mins where the people in the queues were there for 30 mins. The pass also gives you 3 free days of public transport on metro, bus and tram. Metro no more than 10 mins walk away, right next to a supermarket if you want to buy your canned / bottled drinks at a reasonable price. Prices around the main sites can be 5 times more at least! If you fancy a trip to St Peter's try the tram No 19 2 mins walk from the hoel on the same road as the Policlinico metro. The tram takes you directly to St Peter's and is actually quicker than taking the metro with no changes! It also lets you see other parts of the city which you would just miss if you were underground! Metro is hectic at Termini as this is the only junction on lines A & B and they are rebuilding it. Free internet at the hotel, ask for a code at reception. This is a must if you want to book your return seats online. We left our cases in the secure storage at the hotel on the day we left, went into Rome centre, returned later to the hotel and they were happy for us to sit and read the paper drinking their coffee and eating their complementary pastries until it was time to jump on the bus back to Termani to catch the train to the airport. Not bad as we had checked out hours before. Watch out at termini station as platform 25 for the airport is a good 10 minute walk from the front of the station as you have to fight your way through passengers coming in the opposite direction.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Nice staff. I found the location easy to get around the city.”
Reviews.Author: usKathy222
Reviews.Content: The metro is a about 4 blocks away. The 310 bus stops outside the hotel and you can take it to the Termini station where you can pick up the metro if you don't want to walk four blocks. Staff is very nice. Breakfast fine - kids loved it. Dinner in the hotel not the best but there are two very nice restaurants nearby one is to Bracci et Abracci. On the first day with four kids in tow I left the hotel without my husband and was inside the Colosseum 20 mins later. Try the Gelateria across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not so good location”
Reviews.Author: Mollycoddled
Reviews.Content: Spacious family room, friendly staffs, clean hotel. A little noisy from the traffic. Breakfast was ok. Hotel is quite a distant from the metro station. 15 mins walk. But we reward ourselves with the excellent gelato ice cream shop round the corner from the hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Solid value near train station”
Reviews.Author: Canadian079
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night after arriving in Rome. The hotel is located about a 20 to 25 minute walk along fairly quiet streets from Rome Termini. The walk was actually farther than what we had planned. The location is also on the east side of the station while the main Roman antiquities sites are on the west side. We arrived at the hotel around 10:00 a.m. and our room was not available until 2 p.m. The hotel offers complimentary coffee and water, so we relaxed, used the facilities, stowed our luggage (another complimentary service) and then left to visit the sites. It took us about one hour of walking to reach the Palatine and the Colosseum. Returning to the hotel we looked for a nearby restaurant – nothing was open since it was a Sunday. We would recommend you eat near the train station before returning to the hotel. The room was ready. It was large, set for four people. The hotel and room were both very clean and tidy. Our room faced the street so we could not keep our window open due to the noise. The bathroom amenities were fine and plentiful. The breakfast (included in the price) was a buffet featuring fresh pastries, cereal, scrambled eggs and various types of bread. The coffee was hot and very good. This hotel is recommended for its location near the train station, its fair price for Rome and its excellent breakfast. The hotel staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. It has free WIFI in the rooms. The room was very clean and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to review this”
Reviews.Author: sstutler760
Reviews.Content: We had planned our trip and paid for our hotel stay 2 months in advance. Imagine our surprise when we showed up with our confirmation number and they had a full hotel and no way to accommodate us. However, they were very quick to arrange accommodations in a nearby 4 star hotel at no extra charge to us (since they had already charged us for our room). So the review can only offer a little insight...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: 2NRL
Reviews.Content: Just getting off of the sleeper train from Milan, we arrived very early on a Friday, too early to check in. However when I asked where is a good place to eat breakfast, the staff replied "Please have breakfast here, just go downstairs". The breakfast was good and the hotel was clean. The staff were very nice and spoke good english. The bathrooms were big for European standards and fresh towels were always provided. The neiborhood was fine and looked safe. It's a short walk to the Policlinico metro from the hotel which was a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “I would try a different hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: bc3m
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a neighborhood where there is graffiti on the walls. While we did not feel not safe, we didn't like the feel of the neighborhood. The location of the hotel is terrible. We tried using public transportation. For most travelers, public transportation would be okay. However, we had a 22 months old toddler, taking the public transportation was nearly impossible (it is so crowded...there was literally no space to breath). Anyways, so we used taxi to get in and out of the city everyday for 6 days (about 10 to 15 euros each way). The hotel is located on a busy street. The first night they put us on the 3rd floor in a room facing the main street. We requested to change room right away, and they said they didn't have any other rooms available (even though we got there around 2-3 pm in the afternoon). So, we had one sleepless night due to all the traffic you can hear from the street (yes, you can hear every car/mortocycle going by). The rest of our stay, they put us in a room facing the back street on the 5th floor. We were happy with the new room even though there was no bathtub in this room (sleep was much more important to us). There is one curly long hair girl at the front desk who is very nice and helpful (the rest of the staff didn't seem to care much). Breakfast was ok...same everyday...go early then you won't have to wait in line. We were generally happy with the hotel other than the location. Let's just say that it wasn't the worst, but it was acceptable. Also, for those who wants CNN or english channels, just ask the front desk, they'll send a technician and you'll get it the next day. We did enjoy using the free wifi via our ipad from our room.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rose_1969
Reviews.Content: We had stayed 7 nights at the hotel. The hotel is great. It is very clean and big enough for four of us. Although it is a little far from termini station, walking is another pleasant experience. We did enjoy it !

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, poor standard, failed to get the basics right.”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior32
Reviews.Content: Given the amount paid and the glowing descriptions on the website I was expecting a bit more. On arrival my hopes we're quickly dashed and it was clear to see why there is no photo of the outside of the hotel. The entrance consists of about 15 steep steps up to reception (impossible in a wheelchair and tough enough with luggage) and the entire wall at the side of the entrance is covered with personal ad's and public notices. Check in was a simple affair (if you're used to the over complicated Italian registration forms) and I was off to my room in no time. Unfortunately my key card did not work and I had to return to reception, this happened at least 3 times in the first 2 days. The room itself while large made poor use of space which resulted in a substandard bathroom which resorted to a shower head mounted gingerly over a shorter than usual bath. Aside from the variable water temperature and frequent cold showers I was genuinely concerned about slipping due to the poor shower setup. The minibar which was much heralded in the hotel literature consisted of 2 soft drinks and 3 bottles of water, one of which had already been opened. Many hotels give similar as in room complimentary drinks, this one classed it as a minibar and couldn't even manage to refill it once during my 3 night stay. As others mentioned, the walls are thin so you will get to know your neighbours, whether you want to or not. Breakfast was average, lunch while delivered with fanfare was nowhere near the standard of food I've come to expect in Italy. There was free wifi but it involved the receipt system which seems to be so pervasive in Italy. This meant you needed additional receipts if you wanted to use a smartphone as well as a laptop. Much of your time was spent entering usernames and passwords to reconnect you to the system which seemed to stop working regularly. Overall, next time I'm going to Rome, I'll be looking for a different hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevesaint
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying here and had NO complaints about this place. Dont let the low prices put you off booking. It is located in the university district but only a 5 minute walk from Policlinico underground station and from there only 10 mins to the colosseum or the Spanish steps. The holiday is very clean and very well presented. The staff are very friendly and will do anything for you. All the rooms have a complimentary mini-bar which consisted of 2 x cans of soda, 1 x fruit juice and 4 x bottles of water, not bad for free! There is also a fast and free Wifi service. The buffet breakfasts are good too, with fruit, cereals, juice, tea & coffee, yogurts, scrambled eggs, hams, cheeses and a LOTS of pastries. No Sausage or bacon thou, but you can get espresso/latte/cappuchino if you ask.There is a restaurant too but we never ate there so I cannot comment on it. The bathrooms are small but very clean. while the bedrooms are very spacious. We were given a room at the back of the hotel but we didnt hear any traffic noise or other guests, it was just a fantastic relaxing hotel. We would stay here again without any hesitations. *If you are eating out on an evening around the Piazza Navona/Pantheon area I recommend a taxi back as you're a good 20-30 mins from an underground station from there. There are lots of taxis in Rome and a taxi back from that area back to the hotel was always under 15.00 Euro. Rome is hard on the feet, taxis were fast, effecient, clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you're tight on budget”
Reviews.Author: K_OTown
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be a little bit too far away from the metro station. It is also located on the wrong end of where all the attractions are located in Rome so that would explain why it's slightly cheaper than the other hotels. The staff did not seem very receptive to asian people staying there. Although they would greet with you a smile, their body language seemed to say otherwise (not to mention the fact that they mumbled something to each other in italian "blah blah blah cinese blah blah" right in front of us). The room itself was spacious and very clean. It had a very big LCD screen in the room and was properly air conditioned. The decor was a joke with little flowers stickers stuck on the wall to make it "kids friendly". The closet area had a door which you could see through the keyhole into the other room which didn't make any sense. The water temperature of the shower fluctuated constantly no matter what time of day you showered and the tub was VERY high so you'd almost have to jump in and out like a hurdle -- which is not good when you're wet! This hotel is ok if you're on a tight budget (it's almost 30-40% cheaper than ones that are centrally located in Rome).

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: yahooholidays
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room at the Globus. It had bunk beds for the kids, a big comfortable bed for us, a playstation, Italian Freeview and a free soft drink mini bar that got replenished every day. (we drunk it dry every night!). Wifi was available in the room and internet speed was good enough to make free calls back to the UK on BT VoIP. They also had a PC and printer in the foyer which was useful for printing car hire vouchers, vatican tickets etc. The room was great. Staff all spoke english and were very helpful. Free iced water was available in the reception which was a nice touch. Breakfast was better that the typical Italian fare both in range and quality The only downside was the location. This was compounded by a transport strike while we were in Rome. It's a 20-30 minute walk on the wrong side of Termini station and is ~8 minutes walk to Policlinio Metro. There is a bus that runs from Termini that stops right outside.Take the bus if you can. The surrounding area is OK-ish. The University and Hospital are close by but in July there's very few students about. - I didn't feel unsafe, even very late at night, but then again, I'm 6'2 and from Belfast. It was very good value. We actually got the best rate directly on the hotel website and it was a lot cheaper than any of the hotel booking sites. I'm giving the Globus a thumbs up but I hesitated because I'd personally only book again if I couldn't get anywhere within walking distance of the tourist stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!Great value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: pstadnick
Reviews.Content: I stayed 9 nights at this hotel. The service is absolutely amazing, specially from the 2 girls at the reception Daniella and Desiree. The breakfast is great too, buffet style. I was in 2 different rooms during my stay; the first was a bit small but confortable and the second was just the right size. There's plasma tv (but no international channels) and free wi-fi for guests. The hotel is a 10min walk to the metro station and has a bus stop accross the street that takes you to the station (number 310). I loved the hotel and would definetly stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you might expect !”
Reviews.Author: jeffstefano
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that the only thing i can say negative about this hotel is that it isn 't exactly near the center Rome and in the evening, the area gets pretty deserted, but that isnt a bad thing. These rooms are quite nice, that counter staff is very friendly and the buffet breakfast very good. The dining room is verfy bright and cheery. The B" (Blue Train) toward Ribbera will get you there in 3 minutes. Get off the train at Policlinico. Also the same line will take you to the Colessum. All for a Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel if you are in Rome as a tourist”
Reviews.Author: nut_meg28
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty average, located far away from the main tourist attractions. The nearest metro station is Policlino which is about 10 mins walk but the strech is deserted and feels unsafe in the late evenings. There is a bus from the Termini station, but is not frequent in the evenings. Overall travel will take up much of your time. All the staff from reception to restaurant are good though... polite, cheerfull and very helping. The breakfast included was also very good quality, though it would be advisable to arrive early as the restaurant gets extremely crowded by 9:30AM. However our experience there was not very good, having stayed at quite a few other Best Westerns and other hotels. The room was clean, albeit a bit small. The toilet flush was not working properly, and we had to wait for at least 20 mins before the water filled up again!!! The shower was not functioning properly and the water automatically became too hot and too cold alternatively. The free internet was not working in the rooms due to poor network strength. Although there are 2 computers in the reception area they remain occupied pretty much throughout the day. We checked into the hotel late evening and there was no other room available. On complaining, the girl at reception offered to change our room the next day. However we had already opened our luggage and did not want to pack things again...

Reviews.Title: “Below average, not recommended”
Reviews.Author: nasos-greece
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine who went to the medical school nearby recommended this hotel. 99 euros / night and 25 euros / night in the parking 300-400m from the hotel (you keep the keys) next to Kriss hotel. We had to change room 3 times, along with our luggage of course and with nobody to help us. The first time just when we arrived we took a room in the 1st floor with a very nice balcony but with two separate single beds although we asked for a double bed. We took out luggage again and went to the 5th floor where we discovered later that the the water temperature in the shower had a mind of its own making a cycle from extremely hot to extremely cold every 10 seconds, in a shower cabin where it was almost impossible to get in, turn and get out if you were more than 60kgs or 1.60m tall. We told it in the reception, they send a girl to check (who didn't understand english), she saw the problem by herself and when she went back to report the reception called asking the same silly questions just like the girl had never come! He promised to call the plumber the next day, and the next day when we came back late in the afternoon after our visit in Colosseum he said that they fixed it and we can check. They fixed my @ss! We changed room again, now in the 2nd floor with no balcony but with a bigger shower and the water temperature was close to normal. The breakfast room was very small and we had to wait for some time, the variety of food was below average. Wifi internet was free everywhere in the hotel, but in the rooms we had very very poor reception and most times it was impossible to connect. The parking was not open 24/7, but closed 10:00 in the morning and opened after 20:00. So if you forgot something in the car or you wanted to go somewhere, just forget it. The metro (Policlinico) is 400-500m away which was very useful, the area very quiet, and nothing to eat around after 22:00. We stayed with my wife (35/27) for 3 nights, Aug-06/Aug-09. If you want to visit Colosseum, google for Roma Pass or "how to avoid queue lines". It's very USEFUL and combined with metro pass.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: mkh84
Reviews.Content: When we found this hotel (we walked too far), we were welcomed with a large smile and cold water/juice (on the house). The room was nice and tidy. The breakfast was delicious! They even put smileyfaces in the lattes we ordered :) They showed the VM soccer games, which also was really, really great. All in all, this hotel made our visit to Rome a very good one. We will definately stay here, if we visit Rome again :)

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Shank-the-tank
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than what I had expected. The staff was good and treated us well. The Breakfast was awesome. It had AC and hot water working all the time. So no worries there. It is conveniently located and accessible by bus and train. However you need to take a cab if you are going to the Roma Termini with Luggage. However we thought the bathrooms were so cramped that we did not even have space to take bath. It may be true with all hotels in Italy but it was ridiculously small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sameer452
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our children and they just loved their room. the staff was excellent and very friendly. Their breakfast is great and a greta hotel either for self or when travelling with the family it is just 500ms from the metro Policlinico and is in a nice quite neighbourhood with a great bar/snack place just across.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KudosTraveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel if you are travelling with kids. Good size rooms and a very friendly and accomodating staff. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not surreal, just a rather plain 3.5-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: WoodlandCreature
Reviews.Content: The whimsical and somewhat surreal photos on its website (www.globushotel.com) might lead you to think that the Globus Hotel is in some way special or different. It isn't. In most ways, it's a pretty ordinary 3.5-star hotel. But it tries to carry through a theme of games and play (its slogan, in English only, is "Play with us at Globus") and to be kid-friendly. The restaurant, for example, has a domino motif on the cushions, and at dinner each table has a small game. The bathroom has a rack of paper bags each with a picture of a basketball hoop and the annotation (again, only in English) "Score with your sanitary towels". The hotel guide to services offers to bring you toothpaste, a comb, or a beach if you've forgotten to pack your own. So despite anything on the website, my room has no skin-divers nor flying children with winged top hats. It is a plain, undecorated double room, with an entrance hall, a large walk-in closet with its own window, a cramped bathroom, and a very large balcony. The entrance hall adds little to the room, and I wish the architect had designed a different floor plan that gave some of the space to the bathroom instead. I am not a large person, but when I sit on the toilet, my knees bump the shower door and my elbow hits the toilet-paper holder. The shower itself is about as small as a shower can be. The balcony, on the other hand, is much larger than the bathroom, almost as big as the room itself. (Only on the corner rooms are the balconies so large.) It overlooks the intersection below, and much as I'd like to sit out there, the traffic noise and the strong afternoon sun make it impossible. Traffic noise is, in fact, another theme, especially the refrain of the frequent ambulances on their way to the nearby hospital. Rooms at the back of the hotel would be quieter. My room is clean and generally well-serviced. But one day, the maid takes away my partially-used (barely-used!) soap but doesn't replace it; another day, she neglects to replace an empty tissue box. The temperature of the shower varies randomly from day to day. One day it's very hot, the next it's tepid. One morning there is no hot water at all. The Internet connection can be hard to connect to but works well once you have managed to do so. The large, laptop-sized safe is not actually bolted to anything. The breakfast buffet manages at least one or two items from most of the primary European breakfast-food categories, but the largest category is Italian-style cakes and pastries (which put American breakfast pastries to shame). An interesting surprise is several varieties of artisanal honey from a local producer. The location of the Globus is convenient for people visiting the University of Rome Sapienza or other nearby institutions. For tourists, it is literally on the wrong side of the tracks. Nonetheless, Termini is a short ride on the 310 bus, right outside; the number 3 tram, a short block away, goes to the Colosseum and Roman Forum; and, although of limited use for tourists, the Metro is not too far a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Service was excellent Staff extremely helpful . Our room was spacious and comfortable . Breakfast was excellent”
Reviews.Author: snowball2009
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful , Room was spacious and comfortable with airconditioning we could control ourselves . Breakfast was first class with a selection of cooked and cold foods with all the different cereals etc , so our son was happy with breakfast . The computer in the reception area was free to guests so that handy for checking e mails etc . The hotel was located not far from Termini station about 15 minute walk , but the metro was only a 5 minutes walk away . We found a very good restaurant nearby if one was eating in the evening . We would definately stay there again as we found it a comfortable and extremely clean, staff were very cortious and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A good three start hotel”
Reviews.Author: EuroCorrespondant
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Globus and they have certainly done some updating since the last time i went in 2006. It is in a good location only 10 minutes walk straight down from the Termini train station which is also where the coach arrives and departs from for the Ciampino airport - only 4 euros single wih TerraVision which is great. It is only 5 mins walk from the Metro station Policlinico on the blue B line which takes you to the Colosseum, you have to change at Termini for the red line. A day ticket for the Metro is only 4 euros so is good value. There are plenty of ticket machines at the stations which can be used in several different languages. The recetion area is nice and the staff very friendly and polite. Our room was large with 2 double beds, a wardrobe area, balcony, mini bar, flat screen TV (but no English news channels), safe, tea making facilities and balcony. It was nicely decorated. The only problem for me was the noise. The road noise is quite loud and the rooms are not sound proofed so you hear all the noise from the next door rooms, the corridor and because of the laminate floors, footsteps from the rooms above you. I would recommend ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. The bathroom was fine, with bath, toilet, bidet, sink and shower. The hot water took a long time to heat up but was fine when it did. Wireless internet was available in our room. The breakfast was good but not amazing. Usual continental selection, of cereal, breads, cheeses, ham, cakes, fruit and yoghurt. Very good for children though, they provide things like nesquik to drink and there is plastic cutlery, plates and bowls for them to use. All in all a good solid 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD ONE :) SUGGEST IT !”
Reviews.Author: me1234567899999
Reviews.Content: it really was a good one ! I really searched a lot and read a lot of reviews to choose this hotel it is near the metro station ( like 5 minutes walk to get there ) the hotel staff was kind and polite , and they did treat us well the breakfast was good I'll really choose it again if i have a chance to :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for a Great Price, Great Staff, Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaNightowl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the BW Globus for four nights in January. We had a little bit of a problem finding the hotel from the Termini. We took bus 310 for one Euro each as indicated in other reviews. The driver said he'd be our eyes and told us where to get off. We had to ask a couple of different groups of people before we were pointed in the right direction to the Globus. The Globus was located just off the map. We purchased the Roma 3 day Pass that others had mentioned. We utilized the Metro pass that was included for bus and subway. The Policlinico stop was an easy 10 minute walk away. The first and last day we paid the one Euro each to ride bus 310 to/from the Termini station. We rode the Terravision bus to/from the airport and to/from the Termini station. The staff spoke English and were very helpful. The PCs in the lobby were always available when we wanted to use them. The breakfast was wonderful as others have mentioned. We usually ate just one other meal. We enjoyed pizza from Alice's and Solo Pizza which were both nearby. My husband had his wallet in his front pocket and at the subway stop by the Spanish Steps two gals attempted to take it from him. Fortunately he felt the hand in his pocket before they were able to take it from him. We felt perfectly safe walking the streets near the hotel. Our room faced another building so we did not experience the road noise. We were able to adjust the temperature in our room. We had to ask to receive the English channels and we would have preferred FOX to CNN. We spent our days touring the main sites of Rome and Vatican City. They were easty to get to from here. If we're ever in Rome again we will be staying at the Globus!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern family hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Fieldtripmom
Reviews.Content: If you are willing to stay a little out of the city center, this hotel is a bargain. It is hard to find an affordable room for 4 and for the price we chose this hotel for myself, husband and two teen daughters over Christmas holiday. Only drawback was nothing was open nearby during Christmas weekend but lots of shops and cafes within a short walk opened nearby on Monday. The rooms were large, clean, housekeeping service excellent, bath sheet size bath towels (very nice and plenty of them). We had a small balcony with french doors and a window to get fresh air. We also had a walk-in closet which was great for storing clothes. It would have been even better if it had a door to use it for a dressing area. There were free waters and sodas in the mini fridge and the included breakfast was very fresh and beautifully displayed--assorted fresh fruits everyday, breads, croissants, 6-7 types of cereals and meat and cheeses. Only negatives were that we not no control over the heat and the room was hot at night. We were told it was controlled by the floor. You could open the doors for air but then it was noisy (bring earplugs). Also the water heat fluctuated. Only English channel was CNN, we wished we had brought movies to watch on our computer in the room when we crashed after a day of walking all over the city. The free Internet worked great, we used it in our room and in the lobby. 3 or 4 block walk to the subway and then 2 stops to the Termini where you can get on Hop-on-hop=off Buses. Lots of graffiti in hotel area but was safe, lots of elderly residents and college students. If money was not an issue, I would probably stay in the historic city center but for a budget trip with a nice size clean room and pretty easy to get around I would recommend this hotel. Also, we took the hotel car service back to the airport which for 4 people was cheaper than taking the train (45 Euro in a Mercedes). Take good walking shoes and enjoy Rome,

Reviews.Title: “It has something weird room policy.”
Reviews.Author: SNPARK
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel from 29-Dec-2009 to 01-Jan-2010. When I checked in at first day, I arrived around 7pm and I requested my double room as I booked a month ago. But they gave me a single bed room, the bed width is only 120cm(47inch) wide single bed even if I booked 150cm(59inch) wide queen size bed. And, they told me that queen bed width is 120cm wide in Italy, so I complained of weird room policy by searching some Italian hotel information related web-site on my iPhone in front of them. Finally, they accepted my complaint and aplologized to me for their mistake. (I booked the queen size room at "The Best Western Hotel" official web-site. But they asserted that they don't have queen size double bed room. So you should check the size of bed types when you are booking this hotel for a double room.) Second day, They gave me a bigger bed room than I requested queen size bed. It's room size was almost doubled bigger than previous room. Breakfast buffet was normal. Dinner was good and price was also reasonable at the restaurant located under floor. The hotel's location is good. You can reach the hotel by bus number 300 from Termini. Free WiFi access was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for City site seeing”
Reviews.Author: SteveKellyManchester
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at the Best Western hotel in August and couldn’t fault the place. We caught the bus to the Roma Termini from the airport then decided to walk to the hotel which was about a 15/20 minute walk and very easy to find. My first impression of the hotel was that it wasn’t in the nicest of areas, but after a couple of days found the area not to be too bad and safe (it is very close to the universities). The reception area is welcoming and the staff very friendly. We arrived a couple of hours before the normal check in time, but the reception staff stored our luggage and hurried the preparation of our room, while we popped down the road for some lunch. On our return we were given our key and went to our family room which was more than sufficient for a family of four. The room was clean and tidy, and had a stereo, TV (only bbc world news in English, but we hadn’t gone all the way to Italy to watch TV) and air conditioning. The ensuite bathroom was again clean and tidy and enough towels for the 4 of us. We opted for the breakfast option as part of the deal and was pleasantly surprised with what was on offer. Everything was self service, but there was a good selection of cereals, breads, meat, fruit and pastries, along with coffees and fruit juices. As other reviewers have noted the hotel is not in the middle of the tourist areas of Rome, but all can easily be accessed from the very cheap and reliable subway system. The Policlinico subway station is a 5 /10 min walk away. I would defiantly recommend the hotel as a base for exploring the city and it was very reasonably priced compared to most other hotels we saw.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, extremely helpful, very clean. Terrific accomadation and food”
Reviews.Author: Dandare99
Reviews.Content: Excellent reception staff, especially Francesca who went out of her way to assist with our lost baggage. Internet access was free with two PC's available. Very cean superior room with balconey and king sized bed also mini bar with tea and coffee etc although larger cups would help. The location is 500m from Metro line B and 310 bus goes to Termini. If your sightseeing then Globus is ideal Super ice cream shop accross the road. A small ice cream is TOO large. If your a coeliac or need wheat free this is the place to stay. Vast selection of wheat & gluten free food available at a simple request. Also wheat and gluten free pasta available in the evening (cooked in fresh water) Breakfast was fantastic with both hot and cold fare, cereal, toast, super cakes etc Evening dinner had a simple but delicious menu with something for everyone and was all freshly cooked as requested. Young chef, very good Prices very fair and competitive. Room price was a hot deal and was cheaper than many but we will return to Globus as it is the best in Rome....

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Large Rooms, No Problems, Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCub67
Reviews.Content: Just spent 9 nights at the Globus and was completely satisfied. Had a standard king size room and found it to be quite large by European standards and included a balcony. Also saw a room with two queen/double size beds (traveled with a group of family & friends) and found that room type to be pretty large also. I paid 144.00eur per night and feel it was a good deal for Rome. Everything worked great in the room. One small negative was no hot water one morning but that was it, no other complaints. Staff was helpful but not in your face. If you needed help they were there to assist, if not a smile and a welcome back to the hotel when walking in the door was what you got. Arrived at the hotel fairly early AM and room was not available just yet. They allowed us to stash our luggage and have a coffee. Room was ready in less than half an hour and check-in went great. Breakfast was fine every AM and found everything well stocked. Breakfast consisted of coffee, tea, juice, cold cereal, fruit (fresh fruit rather than that syrupy fruit salad you typically get), pastries, bread, yogurt, cheese, eggs, sliced cold meats & a warm sausage/wiener type meat. Basically a typical buffet type breakfast. I didn't eat an actual dinner at the hotel but did have an appetizer and a drink at the restaurant one evening and it was fine and the service good. Location is close to the Policlinico metro stop (10 minute walk at most) and the metro gives you easy access to pretty much all Rome has to offer. I'd say once on the metro your looking at about 10-15 minutes travel time on the train to all the big sites. There's a tabacchi shop right across the street where you can get bottled water, coffee, pastries, sandwich, snacks, wine/beer, etc.... Not a huge selection of restaurants in the area but there are some so you won't starve if your looking for a bite. Do have a restaurant recomendation to make and though it's not right by the hotel, it is definitely worth a trip and easy to get to. The name of the place is Ristorante Mario's (www.ristorantemarios.com) and is a short walk from the Cavour metro stop (third stop from Policlinico and no change at Termini required). The food here is fantastic! I ended up eating here three times which is something I have never done before while traveling. It's really that good. If you get Enzo as your waiter you will be in good hands. He speaks great English and is knowledgeable, enthusiastic and truly make it a fun experience. Would gladly stay at the Globus on any future trips to Rome with no hesitation. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: shonm
Reviews.Content: The area - near the university, very easy access to metro, tram and bus. Very easy access to every were in Rome. A very good breakfast, ask for capuchino! We have upgraded to a superior room - bigger than the regular and with a king size (but not cormtabal) bed. The house keeping can be better - they left a soap at the room from the previous guests, they always forget to feel up the coffe and the milk at the room and the cleanliness can be better. The Wi Fi at the room was slow and the signal was poor. The staff was friendly and very helpfull. But any how - it was a good experience. Try the sandwiches at the coffe (tabbaco) shop at the corner behind. Try the ice cream at the gelateria beside the coffe shop - one of the best in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Will_me
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel with a lot of pros. The price was reasonable. Hotels in Rome can be very expensive. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was the best we had on our 16-day long trip in Italy... very fresh. And the best part is that they will send it to your room if you want without any extra charge. The staff and service were good. The location is a little off the busy areas, but it's quiet and nice. And it's easy to reach the Termini station. Bus no. 310 stops across the road right outside the hotel and gets you to Termini in just about 10 mins. The main negative we found was the shower. We had a standard room and the shower was TINY. So small that you could barely move in it. Using it felt like torcher. But the bathroom was good otherwise. The room was small, but that's how they are in most of Italy. Overall a very good hotel, minus the shower part.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for Rome!”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthGirl
Reviews.Content: Won't repeat everything about the location but we found it fine to be a little off the map. Only a 10 min brisk walk to the Termini station. The price was very good compared to other hotels in Rome. Plenty of restaurants & bars if you take a right out of the main entrance and the best ice cream shop is at the bottom of the street. We only had 2 days on Rome and managed to get everything done by buying a ticket for an open top bus tour.

Reviews.Title: “Overated - Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: brushstick
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of the postive reviews on here. However, on balance I wouldn't want to return. The hotel as most people have said is just two stops away from Terminii on the metro and then a 5-10 minute walk past hospitals so is easy to get to and back to the centre of Rome. Check in seemed like a stress for the receptionist and as a result failed to be forthcoming with any welcoming information in the hotel or city. I had to do all the asking... facilities, breakfast etc. She failed to code the key to the room in her rush to pass me off. The room itself had a balcony...great.....overlooking a busy road and a bomb site. I didn't venture out there! Again no information packs or wlcome packs in the room. Not even a price list for the minibar. The shower didn't provide any hot water during my stay and nothing done about it The website states tea/coffee making facilities in the room......again no evidence. I had a double room to myself whcih was fine for me but if there were two it would have been tight, especially as the bed was square against a wall so one person would have to climb over to get out. Breakfast was standard european fare. The staff were efficient to the point of clearing all my half eaten breakfast away whilst I was getting some orange juice. The road outside is noisy and bin lorries appear in the early hours. One morning a three car crash had occurred and sirens were going all the time. Thankfully Rome at the start of September is not a place where you only need to spend time in the hotel for basics...unfortunately this hotel doesn't rate highly in my opinion on these e.g. showering, information passing ,breakfasting and sleeping

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money, awesome breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: guitarsny
Reviews.Content: We all really liked this place. The breakfast was awesome- fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, pastries, ham & cheese, coffee, tea, juice. Free Wi-Fi. The front desk staff was always extremely nice and everyone at the front desk spoke great English. They helped us know where to go and let us check in at 9:30 in the morning. We were so tired from an all night flight, so we were grateful for that. The room was comfortable, not luxurious or anything, but it was good. The only down side is that it's not super close to the sights in Rome and there's nothing to do right by the hotel. So to do anything, we pretty much had to take the metro, but it's only about a 5-7 min. walk to the metro station. I'd say if you're looking for a comfortable place with great breakfast, and being in the center of everything isn't super important to you, you should definitely get this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leopolean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best western Globus with our two children for three days and enjoyed our stay immensly. For starters, try to get a "Fantasy" room, they have bunk beds for the kids and many other minor kid ammenities. I was able to get one at the same price as a standard Quad room. The hotel was clean, the front desk was helpful, and the breakfast was excellent by Italian standards. Don't forget to ask for cappachino at breakfast. The hotel is around the corner form a bus stop and about a 5 minute walk to the Metro. It is located right next to the University. My only complaint is that because I was there in August, everything near by was closed, however we did find a small market across the street (with limited hours) and a snack bar about 3 minutes away. there is also a group of inexpensive restaurants about a 10 minute walk away. The hotel is definitely not in the middle of the action, but with a little walking or public transportation, you can get to things quickly. Also, the price was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rav1212
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four dayand the hotel was lovely and clean. Staff extremely helpful and the hotel had a great atmosphere. Lovely ice cream parour down the street with the best ice cream I have ever had and lots of pizza and sandwich shops that are more reasonable than eating in the centre of Rome. The 310 bus took you into the centre of Rome in 10 minutes. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: JSWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: My family had an excellent stay in this hotel; the staff was fantastic: very helpful and very friendly; breakfast was good; overall service was superb.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: 4travelers_2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Globus for 3 nights. It was about a 10 minute walk from train metro station and 2 stops away from the train station. Although we did not find many restaurants in the area, the hotel did have one. We did not have dinner there, but were very impressed with the breakfast offerings. The waitstaff was always busy refilling the buffet and cleaning the tables. Fresh fruit was available daily which my kids enjoyed. Our room was very nice and clean. Fairly large with a good size bathroom. The shower nozzle was at a funny angle and it took some effort to keep the water from going all over the floor. The room had AC, TV and a refrig. We had 2 double beds and a huge closet. We also had a small balconey that faced front, but with door closed the street noise was fine. Although we did not find a lot of things to do in the area, the Colosseum stop was only 4 stops away. If you plan on buying a Roma Pass, they are available at the train station. We should have bought it when we arrived in Rome, but the would not sell them past 8:00 in the evening, even though the info. booth was still open. I believe the info. booth was near platform 24 or 25. Buying them when we arrived would have saved us quite a bit on money on the metro the first afternoon we were in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “bargain!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jpae
Reviews.Content: Booked the non returnable internet rate for a quad room so had 4 nights and five days in Rome for £315 bed and breakfast for 4 people, which was excellent value in a modern, clean, fully serviced hotel. Room was large with 2 king sized beds and a double pull out sofa bed, usual furniture, air con, flat screen TV, radio/CD player , hot drinks tray, fridge, and ensuite. Even with the sofa bed extended and 2 grown up teenagers there was plenty of space to move around easily. Free, help yourself coffee, juice , water and biscuits to greet new arrivals or available after a days sightseeing in reception is available everyday, a very friendly reasonably priced restraunt (18 euro fixed price 3 course business menue with carafe of water), free soft drinks from the room fridge and free internet access in lobby. Well furnished public areas to sit and read, a small basement bar and super helpful staff. It markets itself at families (see website) so there are lots of children of all nationalities, but it is also popular with solo business travellers and there was a convention on in the very swish basement seminar rooms during our stay. The hotel is in a residential area of flats and university and hospital buildings away from obvious tourist areas, but is quite safe and on an excellent transport link. The nearest metro station is a very short walk and will take you all over the city for 1 euro (valid for 45 minutes, the local bus stops a few steps from the hotel, and we walked with our rucksacks from Termini station in under 15 minutes. There are a few bars and cafes locallly and a handful of resteraunts (the 'Brasci Abrasci ' recommended by reception was excellent). The hotel looks nothing from the outside and is at the budget end of the best western chain in a very 'real' area away from the tourist sites , but it is excellent value, safe, secure, with good standards and excellent staff. We had a major problem with our credit card when we came to leave and the reception staff could not have been more cheerfully helpful in assisting us with international calls, providing a private room etc. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It's as good as all the reviews say ..... and more”
Reviews.Author: dysonaur
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay with Globus Best Western Rome in two years. We originally chose it for the location, price and quad room. On our second trip we didn't even check out any other hotels. This time we had a Fantasy Quad room. One Double and two bunk beds. We have children aged 3 and 5 and there was plenty of space in the room for them to play. There's even a toy box and toys provided. In the middle of Rome can be noisy but with the windows closed and the AirCon on you will sleep well here. One of the things about this hotel is how spotless it is. The staff were all extremely friendly, pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was perfect, anything you need is available. In the evenings we ate out mostly but came back for a relaxing Italian Beer and Ice Cream in the bar/restaurant, again excellent service. If you order a Taxi with them they can tell you how many minutes it will take. We used a Taxi for two different journeys to get to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain and both cost us €9 for four passengers. Vatican City was a good deal further across Rome and still only cost €18 (25 minute drive). The metro is about ten minutes walk but with young kids we used Taxis a few times. You won't regret choosing this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bearman69
Reviews.Content: Nothing but good things to say .Big rooms for Rome ,Modern ,ours had a coffee maker and fridge .Excellent staff answered all our questions and gave advice when asked .,5 minute safe walk to subway ,Very good breakfast , replenished constantly .excellent price thru expedia.ca

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: capdistrcttravel
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the BW Globus while touring around Rome. The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside but was very clean and modern on the inside. We had a large spacious room with two double beds, a desk, small mini fridge, a table/sitting area, large closet, and a large bathroom. The breakfast was great (breads, meats, cheeses, cereals, great cafe). The computer with free internet located just off the main lobby was nice. With luggage it's a good hike from Termini but wouldn't be a bad walk otherwise, The #310 bus runs right outside the hotel and is only about a 5 min. trip to Termini. Aside from a few small cafe, pizzeria, and gelato stores, there's not a whole lot in the immediate area of the hotel but it makes for a quiet stay. I'd definitely stay at this hotel if I returned to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.. clean and safe.. don't think twice!”
Reviews.Author: JackGoPack
Reviews.Content: Just as many others have said, this hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to the train station and town center. If you are using trians for Tuscany day-tripping, you will really appreciate this as the station is a 3-5 minute skip. Also, contrary to may reports, we are a 50+ year old couple and never felt unsafe walking from the train station to the hotel at night. Kids were always coming off trians at all hours of the night heading to hostels, etc.. so it's busy... not sleezy. The rooms are spotless and comfortable... helpful staff and the continental breakfast is great. Perfect base camp. You can spend more elsewhere, but ...why? We would certainly recommend this hotel to others. (Just one thing, if you have to use your window as air-conditioning, as with so many European hotels, it can be noisy... sirens, etc..)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and value! Our family loved it.”
Reviews.Author: LavaJava96
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Globus for 7 nights in April 2009. What a great find! We booked the online rate, which offered an excellent deal. The hotel is located in the University area of Rome. Our family room was huge, with two queen size bed, which is rare for Europe. It was very clean, and the bed and pillows were comfortable. The room had wood laminate floors, two queen size bed, a dresser with an in-room safe, a little refrigerator which they stock with waters, soda, and juice and is complimentary. We also had a small sofa, and the curtains were attractive, too. The hotel was very contemporary, and felt clean and new. There were four of us (with two children), and we felt very spacious. We did not feel as though we kept bumping into each other. There is a bus (#310) right across the street that you hop on, and it brings you to Termini in under than 10 minutes. You can buy tickets at the Tabacchi shop near the bus stop. At the Termini, you can simply transfer to another bus to get directly to the sights. Coming back, the bus stopped a few meters away from the hotel. It was so convenient, and inexpensive (1 euro for bus ride – good for 75 minutes – includes all bus transfers). The subway (Polilinico stop on the B line) is about a 6 minute walk (and this is walking with a 7 and 5 year old!)… not far at all. My children really enjoyed taking the bus and subways. It was such an adventure to them. There are inexpensive restaurants and food places near the hotel – there is a great gelato place across the street! I thought the front desk staff were really nice – very smiley and friendly. There is a communal computer that is available for free in the lobby. A lot of people used it to send a quick email, which I did, too. Prior to booking, I read that the hotel has a Sony PS2, so I brought some games along, and requested it when we got there. We received it when it became available. They supplied it with several games. It turns out that the US version of games cannot be played on there. But it was nice that they offered it to us. The hotel also had a children movie night, where they offered a showing of Spiderman, or High School Musical, or Herbie, and had chips and soda. That was a very nice touch, I thought. Their complimentary breakfast was delicious. They offered some cold cuts, like ham or turkey slices, and two cheeses, as well as some delicious pastries and cakes. They also have cereal, fruit, yogurt, coffee, and steamed milk. You can request a cappuccino or espresso from the staff. We never found the breakfast room crowded. The breakfast room was very chic, new, and they offer newspapers to read, games for the kids to play (I guess during dinner, but we never ate dinner there). They even had an outlet in the bathroom that you can use (if you are from the US) to recharge your camera, camcorder, or Nintendo DS (in our case) – it could be switched from 110 to 220 V. You didn’t even need to bring an adaptor! We brought one along but noticed it did not work for the Nintendo DS, and their bathroom outlet with the built in adaptor was a lifesaver. The bathroom was large, clean, with a tub, shower. They had 4 LARGE (almost beach towel size) towels for us. All in all, a fabulous hotel, not only for families but for anyone! We put our passports, keys in the in-room safe and never had an issue. We felt very secure there. They also have a great security system. With their room key entry system, they can tell if the room door has been opened. You use the key to get in, and when inside, you keep the key at the inside slot of the door. My husband stepped out to get some food one night, and we must have not had the key at the slot (we didn’t know we had to do it), and their alarm must have sounded since they contacted us checking our names, and if everything was okay. I also noticed a security person walking around the hotel, too. We originally had wanted to stay near Piazza Navona, but it was near impossible to find a hotel room that fit four people, and the ones that did cost at least 2 ½ times this place, and was not nearly as nice, or had as many amenities. I am so glad we came across this hotel. Our children and we had a wonderful time, and it did not cost us a fortune. The only negative to us was that it was noisy outside. We didn’t hear many ambulances going by, but the cars were noisy. It could also be contributed to the fact that we had the windows opened, since it was warm in the room. Their air conditioning system was not turned on yet since it was only April. However, the noise did not really keep us up at night since we were so tired from all the sightseeing that we slept through it. If you are hesitant on staying here, don't worry at all. It was great, and I hope this helps answers any of your questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel outside Rome city center, good value.”
Reviews.Author: swedishtravellers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the nice price, if you compare with other hotels in the same category in Rome. This hotel is located a bit outside the center but it was very easy to take the metro to the Termini central station. The rooms were nice and the hotel was clean. Breakfast was quite simple but had the most things you can expect for a middle class hotel. Staff in the reception were not the best, they could do better. Were not so proffessional. But overall this is a nice and affordable hotel if you are going to the lovely city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Near University”
Reviews.Author: pross2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations in that it was near to the University district and to a large hospital which meant both transport and food services were above average and plentiful. Termini is about a 15 minute walk, the nearest metro train station is about a ten minute walk while buses to Termini are in the same street as the hotel and the tram a block away. The hotel is clean and spacious, breakfast while busy is well organised with table service for coffee and your choice of eggs. The rooms are good although the promised "mini-bar" was missing although a replacement was found after a complaint. The bathroom was spacious and clean. The hotel has a lift and the front desk is helpful - all staff are english speaking.

Reviews.Title: “Most pleasant”
Reviews.Author: FletcherSandton
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant and comfortable hotel to stay at. The rooms are spacious as rooms in a big city go, everything needed for a comfortable stay you will find in the room and the staff are helpful and friendly. Their breakfasts are exceptionally good. One can catch the bus across the road to Termini Railway station and the hotel is not too far from the Metro either. This is indeed a hotel without unpleasant surprises and after our stay at Villa Germaine we realised how very important (and I cannot stress this enough) friendly staff and good service is.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Madridista078
Reviews.Content: Before my wife and I reserved this place we read some reviews online. They were mixed, but the one that I found the least true was the lack of things to do after hours or where to eat. You must remember this is an University part of town. My wife spoke Italian but their English is good enough to understand. They told us to walk around the hotel and find a place to eat since there were several to choose from. We did just that. We found a great eatery down the road (to the right when you come out the door). We ate mussels, pizza and a bottle of wine for under 30 euros. The subway is less than 6 minutes walking distance. The coliseum is two stops over. The hotel is greatly located because of its proximity to the subway.
