While on the subway, as long as you keep your passports hidden (under belt) and your camera handy, you WON'T get pick pocketed. We got a ROMA card, they are also available in Madrid and Barcelona. You can get one at the tourism office next to the coliseum. It costs very little (30-40 euros) and you get in to many different attractions for free and it also serves as a free transit pass. One thing I remember is when we went to the coliseum it was so hot and the line was huge, but there was a special section for the pass holders and we didn't even have to line up, just show and go. Give the hotel a call before you arrive and try to see if you can get a limo service. A driver will pick you up a the airport and drive you in style. The price was 45 euros and no hassle to drive. The airport is quite a distance so make sure you get it. The room itself was great. We found the bathroom small but the AC was very cold since it was nearly 110F that day in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzWex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western for 3 nights commencing the 24th September. The room and ensuite were very clean and cleaned everyday. we also had quite a large balcony which over looked the street below. we strolled in and out to the city centre everyday which took about 15 minutes (straight road into Termini). There was a bus that stopped outside though if you weren't feeling energetic. Theres a lot of small bars and takewaways around the hotel but very little if you want to go out for a meal. There is a very nice restaurant about 5 minutes from the hotel (out door and turn left). Breakfast was good, cereals, pastries, eggs, sausages etc., My only complaint was that the rooms are very noisy. If you are a light sleeper ask for a room at the back of the hotel because otherwise you will be awake all night

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpfree2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with children aged 11 and 8. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful - happy to provide advice and directions in English. A short walk to the metro station with easy access to all of the tourist sites. Our room consisted of two queen size beds, a spacious entry area, large bathroom with bath, and a separate walk in wardrobe. Perfect for a small family. The breakfast buffet included ham, eggs, cereals, fruits, yoghurt, and pastries - an excellent selection with something for everyone. Overall it was a great hotel - highly suitable for families who want easy access to the sites but a quieter environment in the evening. As an added bonus the local pizzeria was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Shawoo
Reviews.Content: Best Western Globus is 6 minutes walk from the Policlinico metro station, and just two stops away from the Termini Station, so it's quite conveniently located. The room was enormous, with two double beds and a sofa bed, and lots and lots of walking space. It was more than enough for me, my wife and two children. The breakfast was very good, and the staff was very friendly and courteous. For 100 Euros per night, I think its excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “All our family like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: qingliu
Reviews.Content: I always like to read the reviews and never wanted to write one. This is my first time becuase all my family liked this hotel. We stayed in Globaus for 2 nights in July, 2008. The price was cheapest that we could find in Rome, Italy - about 66 euro per night. When we arrived, we found the rooms were so big and they even have woodfloor, very clean. One of our rooms even have a big belcone with a table and 4 chairs. We all love the free breakfast buffet. The drinks in the mini bar are also free. To our surprise, it is only 5 minutes to Metro which is 2 stops pass Termini. The staff are all very nice. I have stayed all kinds of hotels Marriot, Holiday Inn, or others. This is the best one in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Book somewhere else this place is disgusting”
Reviews.Author: CCRN31
Reviews.Content: Absolutely disgusting area! No where to park vehicle and really far from center of rome. The "GHETTO" of ROme

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel, no good stuff at all!”
Reviews.Author: MinaGreece
Reviews.Content: We (2 families with young kids) had been there in August 2007 for vacations. 1)At first i have to say that i had called the receptionist from Greece a month before we got there, to ask if they had a garage for our cars and he said yes of course you can use the garage at the basement. And........surprise surprise there was no garage when we got there!!!!!! We argued with the 2 recepcionists but they insisted that if we wanted our cars into a closed parking we shoukd take them in a garage near the hotel which remained closed from 8:00 pm to 8:00a.m in the morning so we wouldn't have the chance to move them even if it was necessary. 2) i also asked them the 2 rooms to be next to each other and they said o.k but this didin't happened either.3) One night my kids were hangry and i asked for the room service. They talled me to call r.s but the woman who answered said :"no english speaking". I called back the reception and they were annoyed at first but 2 minutes later the madame from the room service spoked english magically!!!!!!!!4) the hotel had only one elevator, imagine us staying at the 6th floor and trying for 30 minutes to go up!!!.5) We payed for an suite and a balkony but the balkony was closed and people were working out there even while we were in.....6) The stuff .ohhh!! mama what can i say, they weren't helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “A good value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Montanatraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be a relative bargain in Rome. Prices vary by night. We got our triple room for 99 euros. It had two fulls bed and a small balcony. The room was clean and attractive. It does not have the character of some smaller Italian hotels, but the staff is very Italian. I found them quite helpful. A full breakfast buffet is offered in the downstairs breakfast room. One disappointment: The WIFI was not working in the room or in the lobby when I checked in. The desk did let me use their own hard-wired computer for a bit. If you are getting there by metro check carefully with desk on directions. It is not far, but can be confusing. If you have big bags and are coming from the Termini train station, it might be worthwhile to spend a few euros on a cab. There is also bus service by the hotel, which we did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but no big deal”
Reviews.Author: Margo56
Reviews.Content: Hotwire listed this as being in central Rome, but it's really on the outskirts near the University. Public transportation is relatively OK, but the subway is a bit of a hike and the buses don't run all that often. Room was simple but clean and staff was very friendly. It's a good value for the price, but nothing you'll get too excited about.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting- stay away”
Reviews.Author: Vermont30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dirty, unsafe, and the staff will do nothing to help you. We booked 3 nights in September 2007 as part of our honeymoon. We left after the first night because the hotel is disgusting and unsafe. The bathroom walls and ceiling were covered in black mold, there were half eaten sandwiches in the mini-bar, the beds are cheap metal framed and very uncomfortable and dirty- we slept on towels over the bedsheets. There is no secure parking as the website claims- you have to park on a back street- I was surprised to see the car was still there in the morning. The parking garage is not open to cars- it is full of garbage. The balconies have a view of run down buildings and graffiti. They did not give us the room we reserved- we were given two single beds instead of a double. When I went back to the front desk to complain, the attendant pretended not to understand English- though he spoke it perfectly when we checked in. The hotel is also very close to a bar or nightclub which played very loud music until 2:30am. It was impossible to sleep. Our room was also right next to an unoperating elevator which had exposed wiring coming out of it. We received no refund (we were charged 3 nights though we only stayed one) from the hotel or Expedia. The Expedia agent also commented that when she called to complain on our behalf, there was a "language barrier" and the hotel manager has the attitude that they don't care if we ever come back. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone! See my pictures...

Reviews.Title: “Off center but nice”
Reviews.Author: AmoshJerusalem
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: AmoshJerusalem. - Newly refurbished, the former Tulip Inn (Now Best Western Globus Hotel) is a little off the center of Rome,but this has its advantages: none of the crass commercialism that you find in the more touristy areas, quiet neighborhood and still lively most of the week since it is close to the University, A bus to the central bus and rail station is at the doorstep, and the Metro line a block and a half away. Despite its rating of only three stars the Globus has air conditioning in all rooms, good King-size beds, double glazing on the windows to keep the street noises out. In former years there were complaints that rooms facing the street could not keep windows open because of the ambulances' screaming sirens while they were bringing casualties to the nearby hospital. We slept in a room facing the street, and with the air conditioning on there was no need to keep windows open. Breakfast was included in the price. It was a buffet and while not being a Hilton or Holiday Inn feast, it was adequate and very far removed from the coffee and croissons that you used to get for breakfast in Europe. There was ham and eggs, several kinds of salami and cheese, good coffee, and then some. There is also free Internet for patrons. The hotel has been trying to attract families with slogans such as "come play at the Globus" and there are Playstations in the family rooms. But a large majority are couples and singles in their twenties or early thirties, from many countries including the U.S. and the Far East. Some minor disadvanatages: the refurbishing was still going on and the lift broke down twice daily on the average. Once during the four nights we stayed there, there was a repeated knocking noise on the wall, and the staff could not find where it came from - they gave us another room. On Sunday the whole area closes down, the students go home for the weekend, and to get a sandwich you have to take a bus - these do only a skeleton service on Sundays. To sum up: good value for money, nice for all ages (including seniors like us), and very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 032710a
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with friendly staff. Room was small but comfortable and bathroom was excellent. Shower temperature was a little iffy but that was the only problem. More lifts were needed but the food in the Game was excellent both for dinner and breakfast. Very good internet access in lobby. Overall a good hotel in a very central position of rome (even though its not on the city centre map).

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice@”
Reviews.Author: Maddythehatter
Reviews.Content: Not close to anything. Streets around the hotel crowded during day with university students. No close parking, not close to public transportation and evening meals limited because not much open in the area after 6pm. Lots of street noise during the day, elevators iffy, when they did work. Renovations in progress. Staff not friendly or inclined to work out issues. Towels delivered at the leisure of the staff. With currency conversions, ended up costing over $275USD for one night. On the good side....breakfast was included and was very good. Cab driver questioned my judgment when I told him where I was staying: Offered to recommend several places closer to the Vatican or central Rome. Should have listened.

Reviews.Title: “In Heart of the University”
Reviews.Author: Lilsquirrel
Reviews.Content: At $155 CAD/nite this hotel was the cheapest by far in Rome. They upgraded us free of charge to a huge room w/ a balcony and two queen beds. Very nice hotel. A good 20 min walk to the subway, though, and it is in the heart of the university area so there are no restaurants to go to with the exception of a few convenience stores. We wandered the streets late at night only to go back hungry. Continental breakfast was free, and pretty decent. Rome is an amazing city, and without this hotel we couldn't have done it on budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blippo
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from staying four nights at this Best Western hotel, having booked direct by phone on the Best Western toll free number. We got a promotional rate of 99 euros for room and a substantial breakfast. It is in the University district and we found it a very peaceful area at night. We were given a good sized twin room on the side and it was very quiet. The shower was rather on the small side and I can imagine taller or bigger people finding it a bit tricky! The room was clean and towels and bedding were changed daily. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel has just last week opened a new basement dining area (previously on the top floor). They do now do evening meals, but you MUST book beforehand by asking at reception! We did actually eat in every night except one, because the weather went 'pear-shaped' each night - hail and violent thunder storms one night! The food was fine if somewhat limited in choice. For two of us, we paid between 30 and 50 euros depending on if we had an ice cream. There is no bar operating, but you could purchase a bottle of wine if you wished. There is a fridge in the room and they didn't seem to mind if you bought your own wine in, which we did (discreetly!) The transport into the centre is excellent - bus stop two minutes away and the Metro about 5 mins walk. We bought a 3 day pass and braved the crush! If you have mobility problems this hotel would be difficult and I would not recommend it. For anyone else I would say it is an economic retreat from the bustle of the centre and very easy to get about - only four stops on the Metro to the Colisseum for example.

Reviews.Title: “So so”
Reviews.Author: fatduck
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on a business trip. The hotel is situated near the university and there's not much else around it in terms of restaraunts. You'll need to get the metro to the town centre, but that's less than 5 mins walk. The hotel inside was pleasant, the lift was tiny, but the room was huge with two double beds. Very nice. I had a room next to the restaurant so there was some noise from the kitchen but it wasn't bad. I ate at the restaurant. Initially I was told they were busy (5 people eating at once is busy apparently) and had to come back later which was annoying. The food was ok but the veg were cold. The worst thing was the shower. Water litterally cascaded from the bath surround onto the floor which wasn't very good. But the final bill was surprisingly cheap - good value I thought.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: T&NMcGrath
Reviews.Content: We were here for 6 nights and it's a great base - out of the hussle and bussle of the expensive areas and hotels of Rome and a 5 minute walk to the nearest metro to get you into the centre very quickly. Good hearty breakfast in the morning, but no kettle in the room to make drinks after a long day sightseeing. There is a little row of shops at the end of the street with good chinese and italian restaurants as well as a supermarket and smaller corner shops for general snacks, etc. Good value when you consider how much other hotels cost in the centre of Rome. A bus from outside the hotel goes straight to the terminus. better than we thought it would be - would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: thismortalcoil
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Globus for 3 nights in December 06. The hotel was sufficient, and we were comfortable, but it wasn't without its flaws. The bad: The internet was not working, and the TV sporadically went in and out. I believe we were given a handicap-access room or perhaps a room that was converted to a guest room from a staff area or something...the layout of the room was a bit odd. It was the first room on the first floor, and directly beside the staff room/storage closets. There was a huge wall of curtains, but to our dismay, we pulled the curtains back only to reveal an enormous wall and a window only about 2 feet wide and 1 foot tall. The shower door didn't close well, so the bathroom floor was always soaked. The toilet didn't flush well, either. The room smelled a bit like stale smoke...we requested a non-smoking room and an upper floor and got neither. We were not given any towels and had to request them. There was an air conditioner unit in the room, but it did not work. The staff didn't seem to know if it even SHOULD work..we were told that the hotel was "probably" centrally heated/cooled... The good: The staff was generally great, especially Georgia. She really made our stay pleasant despite the hotel's flaws.They all spoke English and were very helpful. The breakfast (included) was also very good and had a variety of items. About a 5 minute walk from a Metro station, from where you can get anywhere in Rome. Fairly quiet neighborhood. Comfortable beds. Free sodas/waters in the room's mini bar. Good water pressure/hot water in the shower. Free toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wtraveler06
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. Located about a 7- minute walking distance from the metro. Rooms are clean and modern. The breakfast was very good. The staff speak English. It's located on the corner of a rather noisy street, so your mileage may vary.

Reviews.Title: “Five nights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dunderberg
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 2 teenagers) stayed five nights at the hotel and it was rather good. We had a quad room and it was functionally even if it had been better to have three beds instead of two. The AC was excellent because it was very hot in Rome when we were their. I t was rather close to the bus stop and the subway. The internet access was not so good and rather expensive but the most expensive was the water I bought at the bardesk 3,50 Euro for one liter. The room was not soundproof so you could here the neighbors playing cards. Even if the Hotel was clean and the staff was polite there was something that I could call "greedy". For example there was nearly always finished toiletpaper, never and extra at the toilet. Swedish family

Reviews.Title: “The family loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not quite knowing what to expect, my family and I were pleasantly surprised from the moment we reached the hotel. Unlike other reviews here, the property is in fact well placed and easily accessible from the city centre yet away from the noise & bustle of the urban centre. Just 1.5 kms from the Termini, one can easily get there thru cab (for about 6 euros) or by bus no 310. With a 3 year old in tow, access, comfort & security of the property were our prime most concerns. The Roma Globus scored highly on all 3 counts. During our 4 day stay there, we found all the staff very helpful & accommodating. The rooms were adequately spacious with a beautiful view from the balcony. We cherished their hot breakfast spread (even our kid loved it) which kept us going till the -- end of the day. The property is great value for money & I would strongly recommend it for families even with small kids. The Roma Globus helped allay some of the pain of touring Rome (which is not as convenient as other European locations in the summer).

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had reasearched how to get to the hotel before going. We got off at the Policlinico stop, asked one person for directions to the street (viale Ippocrate) and had a 3-4 minute walk - no problem. We found it very easy to go anywhere in Rome from here! The room was clean, large and had a cute little balcony. The area was safe and had small grocery shops (alimentari), pizza take-out places, and a bar across the street. The breakfast on the rooftop was awesome. We loved our stay at the Tulip (now Best Western Roma Globus) mainly because we felt it was a great location and it was clean and safe. We are heading back this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: WWW's
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tulip Inn, Rome for 3 nights in October 2005 and had a 4 bedded room for 2 adults and 2 children. Although not in the city centre, the hotel is convenient as it is about 5 minutes walk from Policlinico metro station, then just 4 stops on the metro to the Colosseum and 2 stops to Termini station. The bus to/from Termini also stops close to the hotel and there is a good value day ticket valid on the metro, bus and trams. The room was clean and large enough for 4 people and as mentioned in previous postings, there is a good buffet breakfast served in the roof top breakfast room. This is a good value hotel, with the city centre easily accessible by public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a quad room and it was great. The service was wonderful especially the concierge Valerio as well as the bartender Stefano. We stayed for one week. The room was spacious and the breakfasts were a great start to the day. The hotel is about a 20-30 minute walk to the city center but it was a pleasant walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: PR_Boy_London
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an overnight stay at the Tulip Rome. We had a great stay. Despite what all of the mostly dare I say LAZY people say in previous reviews, the hotel is incredibly close to the Metro station, about a 5 minute walk and only a few stops away from most attractions. The subway lines are incredibly easy to use and excellent value for money. The Tulip's rooms were well appointed for the price and we had a lovely breakfast the next day. We found the hotel staff friendly and knowledgeable, I wonder from reading the previous reviews if the travellers were as respectful towards the Italian people and culture as they could have been? AND we interacted with several of the hotel staff from the front desk and bar and porters...! I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to anyone and have actually already recommended to friends going to Italy next month.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Angel Of The North
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights taking two rooms for a party of four. Arrived at the hotel around 12.30 / 01.00 am (Transfer from airport with Rome Cabs / Stephano.....brilliant!!!!!!) No problem in checking in at such a late hour. Found rooms to be clean and very presentable, including a fridge with complmentary water and soft drinks, plus a TV with a few English language stations including CNN and Fox News. We let the air conditioning unit run all night and were not bothered by the slight noise. After a quick unpacking session we naturally wanted a drink or two. The night porter was happy enough to open the bar for us, but as it did not look too inviting we asked if there was any bars nearby. He directed us down the street about half a mile away, where we found the all night bar. This turned out to be a shop selling beer, sandwiches, coffee, cigarettes etc etc, so we ended up sitting on beer crates in the street sampling a beer or two at 2'o'clock in he morning. It turns out that it was what Italians would call a bar, but if you want a "drink" you actually need a cafe. Next morning we found the breakfast to be even better than what I had read about. Very attentive staff clear tables constantly while you help yourself to whatever you desire. If you are lucky enough, grab one of the four tables on the outside terrace. For all the hotel is around a mile and a half to two miles from the city centre (railway / bus station) it would not be difficult to walk. However, we purchased a 7 day pass (for all local buses and underground) at the cafe / tobacconists opposite the hotel for 16 Euro. Even using it for only 5 days represented good value. The 310 bus runs every 10 minutes or so from opposite the hotel to the main railway / bus station. From here you can get to where ever you want to be, by bus or underground. As mentioned earlier, the hotel bar is not what we Brits think of a bar as. We did have an odd quick drink while awaiting the other half of our party, and found service to be good. The nearest thing to a decent bar, was an Irish Pub around half a mile away. (Turn right outside the hotel and follow the road down to the "Piazza". Turn sharp right and it is about thirty yards on the right) No restaurants are available on the door step, but again jump on the bus down to the station and you are spoilt for choice. Note that the last bus leaves for your return around 12.00 midnight. No problem if you miss it, as it is not too far to walk, or a taxi will not cost the earth. Opposite the hotel is a cafe with pavement tables. Ideal for a quick drink or snack etc. Further down by the bus stop is a "cake" shop. Ideal to take back to your room with a take away coffee. For those who must have their morning fix of coffee, the cake shop opens around 06.00am. All in all, a clean good value hotel. Our rooms were large but we gather others may not be so. Friendly attentive staff who were pleasant at all times. I would certainly stay here again. Finally......the only minus point. The other half of our party of four reported a broken toilet seat on day two. It had still not been attended to when we left. Oh.......and be carefull with the shower curtain.........my wife flooded the bathroom on the first morning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It -- Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: SashaMilena
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this hotel, I was a bit wary. However, my husband and I stayed here from September 15 - 18, 2005 and I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and even upgraded us to a suite. The room looked brand new and it was very clean. The bathroom was huge with a large jacuzzi tub and a shower with jets. Our room (#602) had a CD player and a small tv in the living room and a flat screen television in the bedroom. We also had a private patio area. The breakfast was pretty extensive. Among the choices were eggs, several different breakfast meats, fruit, cereal, pastries, breads, cakes, juices, coffee and tea. It was a short walk to the subway stop and actually within walking distance of Tremini. I thought the location was nice as it is in a neighborhood with nearby restaurants and you can reach the city centre pretty easily on the subway. I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: alina987
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with a group, and they were not at all accomodating for anyone. Though the rooms were larger than normal, the bathrooms were never clean enough and I had to resort to wearing flip flops. Furthermore, a lone spider was found in our room. The AC dripped and the drain of the shower was partially clogged, with hotel not fixing the problen during our 3-night stay. The hotel is lacking basic customer service skills, and is very un-helpful for foreign tourists during their first time in rome. Though the internet is available in the hotel, the outrageous rates are more than double of the rates offered one block away in this in-expensive student area. The telephones were not usable even with a phone card. The hotel is not conveniently located in the center of rome, and you will need constant taxi expense just to see the sights. Skip the headaches and keep looking elsewhere, where you'll most likely get more value for your hard earned money

Reviews.Title: “good 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: very good 3* hotel in university district of rome. can confirm breakfasts are good. we stayed aug 22 2005 for 3 nights. allocated room 219 which was at rear of hotel with a balcony. room had 2 double beds and was a good size. bathroom needed upgrading but was acceptable. very quiet around hotel and not much open hence difficult to find a restaurant. this was probably due to it being august and university closed. staff very helpful. would stay at hotel again. payed expedia £146 for 2 people for 3 nights including breakfast. excellent value. took taxi to hotel from termini station but no need to. metro stop (policlinico) only 10 mins away otherwise take bus 310 which stops outside. public transport only 1 euro each person - taxi 10euro total.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel in a Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed at this hotel for three nights in July 2005. The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable, all of the three rooms we had were well equipped with air conditioning (a necessity in July I can tell you). The Buffet breakfast was excellent and served in the charming little 5th floor dining area / terrace. All the staff we found at the hotel to be extremely helpful and friendly and speak perfect English. The hotel location is just what we wanted and is in a quiet more residential area of Rome. Walking around this area both day and night you never feel threatened. We found this to be a godsend, as it was lovely to return to a much more sedate area of the city in an evening, and allowed us to leave behind the tourist traps (and many pickpockets) of the trevi fountain / piazza navona area. Saying that the metro stop of Policlinico is only about 5 mins walk and takes less than 5mins to reach the centre, and a taxi only costs 8 euros if you need one. There is a great little bar situated directly across the road from the hotel which serves the perfect “ice cold” peroni, and even hands out free sandwiches with each drink!. For a lovely “local” meal at unbelievably cheap prices (cheaper than in the very centre of rome) go right out of the hotel and walk for about 5 mins. It's called “Il Tesoro”, and the calzone is to die for, and a three course meal with drinks will set you back just 15 euros! (in my opinion this was the best food we had during our stay and I couldn’t recommend it more!) So to sum up : the hotel is modest in size, it’s clean, has very friendly staff, a nice “out of it all” location”, has good transport links to the centre, serves a great breakfast, and has great restaurants within walking distance, and if like us you use Expedia can be booked for the bargain price of £45 per room per night. Highly recommended, and would stay here without hesitation again (even if it’s just to return to “Il Tesoro!” )

Reviews.Title: “I was stole on this hotel. Be careful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was stole at my room on this hotel. When I went to take my breakfast someone enter in my room and stole my money. I lost about 250 euros. My wife realized one day that it may was missing some money, so we counted the money on the night, we did not leave the room more, then we went to breakfast and when we came back was missing 50 euros, and we think they took money all the other nights too. The staff said they could do nothing about because a lot of people work at the hotel. So be careful and I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place on a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked a family room for four. When we arrived we were asked if we wanted two double beds or a double and a set of bunk beds. Our kids went for the bunk beds and the room was very spacious. The only issue was the door lock jammed on first day. They immediately moved us to a similiar room, door lock worked fine. Breakfast buffet was on fifth floor but worth it. Large buffet in the morning made for a great day! Location was a short walk from subway. Small grocery and several restuarants on the same street. Staff was great. Will stay again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful! Not a good hotel to recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with our 6-month-old baby. It was a terrible experience for us. The first 2 nights they assigned us to a room not rennovated. The room was so hot even with air conditioner running! Also the room is very very small with only full size bed. Our baby was uncomfortable and got a fever so we requested a room with a working air conditioner. They re-asigned us to a rennovated room which is much nicer and the bed is larger. However we will never stay in this hotel again because of our terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back 2 weeks ago from Tulip Inn and would say its good value for money- just don't expect the rooms to be as nice as the lobby! The bathroom really was very small but room itself was a generous size. However the wooden floor may not be suitable for all tastes. Also the heating only switches on in the evening, so if you are in the room during the day it may feel chilly (during winter months). The breakfast was excellent- lovely range of croissants and cakes. And don't worry if you wake up late- there is always loads left! Policlinico station is a 5min walk and it is definitely worth buying the combined bus-metro travelcard- 3euros for 1 day or 11euros for 3 days. All of the main sites are only a few stops away. There is a fantastic ice-cream parlour that I highly suggest everyone staying at this hotel go to. As you exit the hotel, turn right and follow the road down. The parlour is on the left-hand side towards the end of Ippocrate. Very yummy ice-cream awaits! I personally would not stay here again as I hated the bathroom but overall its a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but be warned: Arrive early”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beware the guaranteed booking! We had booked a family room for two adults and two children (which feature prominently on the Globus website) about 4 months in advance of our October 2004 trip. Arrived at 5pm on a Saturday night during school holidays to be told they had no booking and no free rooms, despite having booked and provided credit card details over the internet. Luckily I had all the emails printed and with me! No luck the first night however, and we had to catch a taxi, stay in another hotel (more expensive but Globus made the phone calls) and then taxi back the next day for the remainder of our 4-night stay. Basically wasted one day of the stay as a result. After much investigation it seems likely we were bumped because they had a large (and loud!) tour group in the hotel and needed the room. OK location, 10-15 minutes walk to metro then 2 stops to Termini. Good family room with double bed for parents and bunk beds for kids. Best to get a room with balcony overlooking quiet back street, as front entrance faces busy street corner. Breakfast ok, good for loading up before busy day sightseeing in Rome. Good English spoken by staff.
